articles.description: Millions watched the grainy black & white images as Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin set foot on the moon 50 years back.
articles.content: A half-century ago, in the middle of a mean year of war, famine, violence in the streets and the widening of the generation gap, men from planet Earth stepped onto another world for the first time, u… [+777 chars]

articles.author: Kevin Pimbblet, University of Hull
articles.title: First Black Hole Photo Confirms Einstein's Theory of Relativity - The Quint
articles.description: To cut a long story short: Einstein was right.
articles.content:
With a sense of excitement, I watched the live stream showing the image of the black hole from the centre of M87 for the first time.
The most important initial take-home is that Einstein was right. … [+429 chars]

articles.author: Cyrus John
articles.title: SpaceX or ISRO, Who’s Winning the Race to Space? - The Quint
articles.description: ISRO versus SpaceX. Where does India’s premier space agency stand against Elon Musk’s organisation?
articles.content:
I am not going to pick a winner because of a lot of reasons. One of them is that I like both of them.
SpaceX is a 15-year-old company, which has made heavy-lift reusable launch vehicle, while ISRO i… [+650 chars]
